metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of Euphrates poplar forest station downstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014.The station is located in Inner Mongolia ejin banner dalaihubu town four road bridge, under the surface is hu Yang Lin and tamarix.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 101.1239e, 41.9932n and 876m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 28m, facing due north.The wind speed sensor is located at 28m, facing due north.Two four-component radiometers were installed at 6m and 24m respectively, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 24m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.Two photosynthetically active radiators were installed at a position of 24m, facing due south, with one probe vertically upward and one probe vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm and 4cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil moisture sensor (installed on March 15, 2014) was buried 2cm and 4cm underground, located 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28m, RH_28m) (unit: c, percentage), wind speed (WS_28m) (unit: m/s), the radiation of 24 m four component (DR_1 UR_1 DLR_Cor_1 ULR_Cor_1 Rn_1) (unit: watts per square meter), the radiation of 6 m four component (DR_2 UR_2 DLR_Cor_2 ULR_Cor_2 Rn_2) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Degrees Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm) (unit: c), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), up and down photosynthetic active radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (unit: second micromoles/m2).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2014, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al.(2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).

该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游胡杨林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是胡杨林和柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1239E, 41.9932N，海拔876m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；风速传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；两台四分量辐射仪分别安装在6m和24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器（2014.3.15安装）分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、24m四分量辐射（DR_1、UR_1、DLR_Cor_1、ULR_Cor_1、Rn_1）(单位：瓦/平方米)、6m四分量辐射（DR_2、UR_2、DLR_Cor_2、ULR_Cor_2、Rn_2）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改进了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的测量值就能进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率–能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们展示了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a method used to ensure data quality and control during data collection in hydrometeorological observational studies?

Example.AnswerEn: In hydrometeorological observational studies, data quality and control are ensured by several methods, such as ensuring that there are 144 data entries per day (one every 10 minutes) and marking any missing data with a specific value like -6999. Duplicate records are removed, data exceeding physical or instrument limits are deleted, and any questionable data are marked in red. Additionally, date and time are formatted consistently, and naming conventions are standardized, as seen in the dataset of the Heihe River Basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在水文气象观测研究中，数据质量和控制通过多种方法得以确保，例如确保每天有144条数据记录（每10分钟一条），并用特定值如-6999标记任何缺失的数据。重复记录被删除，超出物理或仪器限制的数据被删除，任何可疑数据被标记为红色。此外，日期和时间格式一致，命名规范也得到标准化，如在黑河流域的数据集中所示。

Example.QuestionCn: 提供一个例子，说明长期观测数据集如何用于研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换。
Example.AnswerEn: An example of long-term observational datasets used to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems can be found in the data collected from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB). These datasets, collected from 2012 to 2021, include turbulent flux data, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters, and are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 用于研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集的一个例子可以在黑河流域中下游的人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统中找到。这些数据集从2012年到2021年收集，包括湍流通量数据、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数，并可从国家西藏 Plateau 数据中心获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the primary characteristics of a dataset collected from meteorological observation networks in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 来自干旱地区气象观测网络收集的数据集的主要特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, radiation, soil temperature, moisture levels
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度，相对湿度，风速，辐射，土壤温度，湿度水平

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes are essential for ensuring data quality and control in hydrometeorological datasets?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 确保水文气象数据集数据质量和控制的具体属性有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: consistent data formatting, marking of missing data with a placeholder, removal of duplicate records, exclusion of data beyond physical or instrumental limits, standardized date and time representation, data flagged as questionable
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 一致的数据格式，用占位符标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，排除超出物理或仪器限制的数据，标准化日期和时间表示，标记为可疑的数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of data collection methods used in oasis–desert system studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统研究中使用的数据收集方法的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic weather stations, supplementary observations of vegetation and soil parameters, half-hourly or 10-minute averages
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站、植被和土壤参数的补充观测、每半小时或10分钟的平均值。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of the 'eddy covariance system' in data collection for hydrometeorological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 涡度相关系统在水文气象研究的数据收集中有什么重要意义？
Definition.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system is crucial for measuring turbulent fluxes, such as energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, which are essential for understanding energy and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统对于测量湍流通量（如能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量）至关重要，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和碳交换至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is the term 'two-source energy balance (TSEB) model' defined in the context of evapotranspiration estimation?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在蒸散发估算的背景下，“双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型”是如何定义的？
Definition.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is used to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by considering separate soil and canopy components, which is important for accurately modeling energy exchanges in heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型用于估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散，通过考虑土壤和树冠的独立组成部分，这对于准确模拟异质景观中的能量交换非常重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of measuring evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes differ when using a one-source model versus a two-source model like the TSEB?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用单源模型与像TSEB这样的双源模型测量蒸散发时，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: One-source models, which combine soil and vegetation components into a single source, often struggle with accuracy in heterogeneous landscapes where different surfaces exhibit varying temperatures and resistances. This results in less precise evapotranspiration estimates. Two-source models like the TSEB separate these components, allowing for more detailed representation of energy partitioning and surface interactions, thus providing more accurate estimates. However, they require more complex inputs and calibration, such as component temperatures, making them more challenging to implement but potentially more effective in diverse landscape conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 单源模型将土壤和植被组件合并为一个单一源，在异质景观中往往难以保持准确性，因为不同表面表现出不同的温度和阻力。这导致蒸散发估算的精确度降低。双源模型如TSEB将这些组件分开，允许对能量分配和表面相互作用进行更详细的表示，从而提供更准确的估算。然而，它们需要更复杂的输入和校准，例如组件温度，这使得它们在实施上更具挑战性，但在多样化的景观条件下可能更有效。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of ground-based measurements and satellite data improve the accuracy of energy balance models in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 地面测量与卫星数据的结合如何提高绿洲-沙漠生态系统能量平衡模型的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of ground-based measurements, such as those from a high-resolution thermal camera and an eddy covariance system, with satellite data can enhance the accuracy of energy balance models by providing comprehensive datasets that capture both soil and canopy component temperatures. This allows for better validation of model estimates against observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration, and can help address issues related to the heterogeneity of the landscape and the strong advective conditions in arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量数据（如高分辨率热像仪和涡度协方差系统）与卫星数据相结合，可以通过提供捕捉土壤和树冠组件温度的综合数据集来提高能量平衡模型的准确性。这使得模型估算与观察到的蒸发和蒸腾比率之间的验证更加有效，并有助于解决与景观异质性和干旱地区强烈平流条件相关的问题。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in using composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions, and how can these be addressed through data collection methods?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用复合温度分离方法可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何通过数据收集方法来解决这些问题？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions include errors in image classification that affect the estimation of soil and canopy temperatures, especially with varying vegetation abundance. These challenges can be addressed by employing accurate classification methods, such as the maximum-likelihood method, and by using high-precision thermal infrared cameras to obtain reliable radiometric temperatures. Additionally, accounting for atmospheric variables like upwelling radiation and transmittance can reduce uncertainties in temperature estimations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区使用复合温度分离方法面临的挑战包括图像分类中的错误，这会影响土壤和冠层温度的估算，尤其是在植被丰度变化的情况下。可以通过采用准确的分类方法，如最大似然法，以及使用高精度的热红外相机来获取可靠的辐射温度，从而解决这些挑战。此外，考虑大气变量，如上行辐射和透射率，可以减少温度估算中的不确定性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What data collection strategies can be employed to understand the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以采用哪些数据收集策略来理解绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换之间的相互作用？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: To understand the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert systems, data collection strategies should include long-term observational datasets from both artificial and natural systems. This involves using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer to measure turbulent fluxes, automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, and supplementary vegetation and soil parameters. Such comprehensive datasets allow for a quantitative understanding of these interactions and support the ecological stability and sustainable development of oases.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 为了理解绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换之间的相互作用，数据收集策略应包括来自人工和自然系统的长期观测数据集。这涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来测量湍流通量，自动气象站用于获取水文气象数据，以及补充的植被和土壤参数。这种综合数据集能够定量理解这些相互作用，并支持绿洲的生态稳定性和可持续发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying reasons for the observed discrepancies in energy balance closure when using eddy covariance systems in irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在灌溉农业区域使用涡度协方差系统时，观察到的能量平衡闭合差异的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in energy balance closure with eddy covariance systems are primarily due to the strong advective conditions in irrigated agricultural areas. These conditions cause errors in estimating surface-air temperature differences, which are crucial for accurate flux measurements. The complex nature of soil and canopy interactions under advective conditions, coupled with uncertainties in component temperature determination, further complicates achieving energy balance closure.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统时，能量平衡闭合的差异主要是由于灌溉农业地区强烈的平流条件。这些条件导致在估计表面与空气温度差异时出现误差，而这些差异对于准确的通量测量至关重要。在平流条件下，土壤和树冠相互作用的复杂性，加上成分温度确定的不确定性，进一步使得实现能量平衡闭合变得更加复杂。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the inclusion of soil and vegetation component temperatures influence the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates using the TSEB model?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 土壤和植被成分温度的纳入如何影响使用TSEB模型估算蒸散发的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Including soil and vegetation component temperatures enhances the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates when using the TSEB model. By utilizing ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, the TSEB model can better partition evaporation (E) and transpiration (T). This approach helps in producing reliable estimates of E/ET% and T/ET% ratios, as well as overall ET, under various vegetation types and climatic conditions, particularly in complex heterogeneous landscapes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 包括土壤和植被组分温度可以提高使用TSEB模型的蒸散发估计的准确性。通过利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，TSEB模型能够更好地划分蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。这种方法有助于在各种植被类型和气候条件下，特别是在复杂的异质景观中，产生可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及整体ET的估计。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using a thermal infrared camera for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in terms of data accuracy for energy flux estimations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用热红外相机测量土壤和冠层组分温度在能量通量估算方面的数据准确性会产生什么后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing a thermal infrared camera for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures can significantly enhance the accuracy of data used in energy flux estimations. The high precision of thermal infrared cameras allows for accurate separation of soil and canopy temperatures, which is crucial for calculating latent and sensible heat fluxes accurately. This method provides robust temperature data that improve the performance of models like TSEB, leading to more reliable estimates of energy fluxes and evapotranspiration in diverse environmental settings.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用热红外相机测量土壤和冠层组件温度可以显著提高用于能量通量估算的数据准确性。热红外相机的高精度允许准确分离土壤和冠层温度，这对于准确计算潜热和显热通量至关重要。这种方法提供了可靠的温度数据，改善了像TSEB这样的模型的性能，从而在多样的环境条件下提供更可靠的能量通量和蒸散发估算。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of collecting hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems using an array of automated weather stations and land surface flux stations?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中使用一系列自动气象站和地表通量站收集水文气象数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, supporting ecological security, and ensuring sustainable development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、支持生态安全以及确保绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use a series TSEB model and high-resolution thermal camera for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在强对流灌溉农业区使用系列TSEB模型和高分辨率热成像仪来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because the TSEB model, combined with soil and canopy component temperatures from a high-resolution thermal camera, allows for accurate separation of latent fluxes from soil and vegetation components, which is critical for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in such challenging environments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为TSEB模型结合高分辨率热像仪的土壤和冠层组件温度，可以准确分离土壤和植被组件的潜在通量，这对于在如此具有挑战性的环境中估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the long-term goals of maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems through the collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 通过收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据来维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间平衡的长期目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The long-term goals include protecting ecological stability, supporting socioeconomic development, and recognizing oasis–desert interactions, which are significant for the sustainable development of oases and for addressing ecological challenges in arid and semiarid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期目标包括保护生态稳定、支持社会经济发展，以及认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，这对绿洲的可持续发展和应对干旱及半干旱地区的生态挑战具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality control of meteorological data collected from an automatic weather station in an arid region?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在干旱地区收集的自动气象站气象数据质量控制的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The quality control of meteorological data involves ensuring that there are 144 data points each day, marking missing data with a specific code (-6999), removing duplicate records, deleting data that are outside physical limits or instrument ranges, and marking questionable data in red. Additionally, the date and time formats are standardized, and naming rules are applied to the datasets.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 气象数据的质量控制涉及确保每天有144个数据点，用特定代码（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理限制或仪器范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。此外，日期和时间格式被标准化，并对数据集应用命名规则。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the separation of evapotranspiration into soil and canopy components achieved using remote sensing and field data?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何利用遥感和实地数据将蒸散发分离为土壤和冠层成分？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The separation of evapotranspiration into soil and canopy components is achieved by using a two-source energy balance model (TSEB) that utilizes ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures. High-resolution thermal imagery is used to extract soil and canopy temperatures, which are then processed through classification methods to distinguish between soil and canopy pixels. These temperatures are then used in combination with energy balance equations to estimate the latent heat fluxes of soil and canopy separately.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 通过使用两源能量平衡模型（TSEB），将蒸散发分离为土壤和冠层成分，该模型利用地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度。高分辨率热成像用于提取土壤和冠层温度，然后通过分类方法处理以区分土壤和冠层像素。这些温度随后与能量平衡方程结合使用，以分别估算土壤和冠层的潜热通量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the detailed measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在异质景观中能够详细测量土壤和冠层成分的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras and the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model have enabled the detailed measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures. These advancements allow for more accurate estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by separating soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用和双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的应用，使得土壤和冠层组件温度的详细测量成为可能。这些进展使得通过将土壤和植被组件温度与复合辐射温度分离，从而更准确地估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the separation and accurate estimation of latent heat fluxes of soil and vegetation components in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域中分离和准确估计土壤和植被成分的潜热通量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The separation and accurate estimation of latent heat fluxes of soil and vegetation components are enabled by the TSEB model, which utilizes soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures obtained from high-precision thermal infrared cameras. This model facilitates reliable estimations of energy partitioning in complex environments such as strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: TSEB模型通过利用高精度热红外相机获取的土壤和植被组件的辐射温度，能够分离和准确估计土壤和植被成分的潜热通量。该模型在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域等复杂环境中，有助于可靠地估计能量分配。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What reasons could explain the limited application range of certain evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 某些蒸散发模型在异质景观中的应用范围有限的原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The limited application range of certain evapotranspiration models in heterogeneous landscapes can be attributed to the complexity of capturing the mixed soil and vegetation characteristics, as well as the difficulty in obtaining necessary model parameters and observations from operational satellite- and ground-based data. Additionally, these models often require detailed component temperature measurements that are not readily available.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 某些蒸散发模型在异质景观中的有限应用范围可以归因于捕捉混合土壤和植被特征的复杂性，以及从操作卫星和地面数据中获取必要模型参数和观测值的困难。此外，这些模型通常需要详细的组分温度测量，而这些测量并不容易获得。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for long-term observational datasets in understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时需要长期观测数据集？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial for understanding the dynamic interactions and balance between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems. Such datasets provide comprehensive insights into the temporal variability and trends necessary for ecological stability, sustainable development, and achieving carbon neutrality goals, especially in the face of climate change and ecological degradation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换之间的动态相互作用和平衡至关重要。这些数据集提供了对时间变异性和趋势的全面洞察，对于生态稳定、可持续发展以及在气候变化和生态退化面前实现碳中和目标是必要的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can long-term observational datasets contribute to a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集可以通过哪些方式促进对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的更好理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets provide critical insights into the dynamics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems by capturing temporal variations and trends over extended periods. These datasets allow researchers to study the interactions between oasis and desert systems, assess the impact of climate change, and evaluate the ecological stability and carbon balance within these regions. They also support the development of models and strategies for sustainable oasis development and ecological security, offering a quantitative basis for recognizing oasis–desert interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集为研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的动态提供了重要的见解，通过捕捉长期的时间变化和趋势。这些数据集使研究人员能够研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，评估气候变化的影响，并评估这些地区的生态稳定性和碳平衡。它们还支持可持续绿洲发展和生态安全的模型和策略的制定，为识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用提供了定量基础。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about how meteorological data from remote sensing can be integrated with ground-based observations for comprehensive analysis.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定如何将遥感的气象数据与地面观测相结合进行综合分析。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The integration can be achieved by using models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which employs ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. Ground-based data, such as those from eddy covariance systems and meteorological parameters measured at fixed intervals, supplement the remote sensing data to provide a more comprehensive analysis.

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and describe the methods used for data collection in hydrometeorological networks, particularly focusing on how sensor placements and orientations affect data quality and accuracy.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨和描述水文气象网络中数据收集的方法，特别关注传感器的放置和方向如何影响数据质量和准确性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In hydrometeorological networks, such as those monitoring the Heihe River Basin, sensors are strategically placed to capture accurate atmospheric and soil data. For instance, air temperature and relative humidity sensors are positioned at a height of 28 meters, facing north, to minimize interference from surrounding vegetation and structures. Wind speed sensors are also placed at the same height and orientation. Radiation instruments are set at varying heights (6m and 24m) and orientations to capture comprehensive solar and thermal data. Soil temperature and moisture sensors are embedded at different depths and distances from the meteorological tower to ensure accurate ground-level readings. Such careful sensor positioning and orientation are crucial for minimizing data inaccuracies due to environmental obstructions and ensuring the integrity of the dataset for further analysis and application.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在水文气象网络中，例如监测黑河流域的网络，传感器被战略性地放置，以捕捉准确的大气和土壤数据。例如，空气温度和相对湿度传感器被放置在28米的高度，朝北方向，以最小化周围植被和结构的干扰。风速传感器也被放置在相同的高度和方向。辐射仪器则设置在不同的高度（6米和24米）和方向，以捕捉全面的太阳和热量数据。土壤温度和湿度传感器嵌入在不同的深度和距离气象塔的位置，以确保准确的地面读数。这种精心的传感器定位和方向设置对于最小化由于环境障碍造成的数据不准确性至关重要，并确保数据集的完整性，以便进行进一步的分析和应用。
